title: Michael Caine, Sigourney Weaver and Juliette Binoche Among Red Sea Film Festival Honorees
description:
The 2025 Red Sea Film Festival, which kicks off in Jeddah on Thursday, has started to unveil its lineup of honorees. 

	Never ones to shirk away fro
body:
The 2025 Red Sea Film Festival, which kicks off in Jeddah on Thursday, has started to unveil its lineup of honorees. 

	Never ones to shirk away from pulling star power, the Saudi Arabian festivalâ€™s â€œfirst waveâ€ of names includes screen icons from the U.K., U.S. and France in Michael Caine, Sigourney Weaver and Juliette Binoche. Meanwhile, French-Algerian filmmaker Rachid Bouchareb and Hong Kong action cinema legend Stanley Tong are also being honored. 
	

	Binoche is also set to appear as part of the Kering | Women in Motion program, which includes the initiativeâ€™s first panel discussion held at the Red Sea festival this year. Launched in 2015 in Cannes, Kering | Women in Motion aims to highlight the talent and diversity of women, both in front of and behind the camera. 


	Alongside Binoche, the panel will also include Saudi filmmaker Shahad Ameen and Palestinian-American actor and filmmaker Cherien Dabis, and will be moderated by the Red Seaâ€™s director of international programs, Finn Halligan. 

	â€œEach of this yearâ€™s Red Sea Honourees represents the very best of global film â€“ artists whose work has inspired audiences around the world and added to the fabric of cinematic culture,â€ said Faisal Baltyuor, CEO of the Red Sea Film Foundation. â€œWeâ€™re looking forward to celebrating their extraordinary contributions during our fifth edition of the festival this year and fostering conversations that will offer meaningful insight and inspiration to our filmmakers, our audiences, and the regionâ€™s rapidly evolving film community.â€

	The Red Sea yesterday revealed some of the names taking part in In Conversation sessions this year, with Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Adrien Brody and Sean Baker currently confirmed.

schema.headline: Michael Caine, Sigourney Weaver and Juliette Binoche Among Red Sea Film Festival Honorees

title: Oscar-Qualifying Short â€˜Cloutâ€™ Boarded by New Europe Film Sales (EXCLUSIVE)
description: New Europe Film Sales has secured world rights for â€œClout,â€ the Oscar- and BAFTA-qualifying short film from Jordan Murphy Doidge starring â€œJojo Rabb
body:
New Europe Film Sales has secured world rights for â€œClout,â€ the Oscar- and BAFTA-qualifying short film from Jordan Murphy Doidge starring â€œJojo Rabbitâ€ breakout Archie Yates. 

	Written and directed by Doidge, â€œCloutâ€ follows 13-year-old Oskar (Yates), whose â€œdesperate pursuit of attention spirals into something sinister,â€ according to the shortâ€™s synopsis. Described as â€œBlack Mirrorâ€ meets â€œStand by Me,â€ the short examines issues of â€œidentity, vulnerability and the dark side of coming of age online.â€
	

	New Europeâ€™s shorts catalogue has included over 15 Oscar-shortlisted films, including the 2017 best live-action short winner â€œSingâ€ and 2019 nominee â€œWeekends.â€ They have also repped shorts by Ruben Ã–stlund, Magnus von Horn, Niki Lindroth von Bahr, Laura Moss, Hlynur PÃ¡lmason, Reka Bucsi, Jonas Odell and more. 


	â€œCloutâ€ had an Oscar-qualifying premiere at HollyShorts in Los Angeles and has since launched a sold-out U.K. tour of the film in partnership with Everyman cinemas. Alongside Yates, the short stars Anna Wilson-Jones (â€œBlack Mirrorâ€), Nadine Marshall (â€œTatamiâ€) Samuel Leakey (â€œGretel & Hanselâ€) and newcomers Obi Laughton Oleforo and Ashwin Chandrasekaran, as well as Kit Price, a model and actor with more than 1 million TikTok followers. 

	â€œNew Europe is proud to bring â€˜Cloutâ€™ to the world stage,â€ said Nela ZieliÅ„ska, head of shorts at New Europe Film Sales. â€œDoidge has crafted a film that captures the zeitgeist with emotional depth and cinematic precision. We believe it will resonate strongly with festival programmers, platforms and audiences worldwide.â€
	

	â€œCloutâ€ is produced by Francis Chapman (Sundance grand jury prize winner for â€œIn the Summersâ€) and co-produced by Lindsay Cullen. The filmmakers have also partnered with the U.K. charities Family Lives, The Mix, Into Film and Arts Emergency to lead post-screening discussions surrounding youth mental health and digital harm.

schema.headline: Oscar-Qualifying Short â€˜Cloutâ€™ Boarded by New Europe Film Sales (EXCLUSIVE)

title: â€˜Culinary Class Warsâ€™ Season 2 Trailer Drops on Netflix Ahead of December Return
description: Netflix is gearing up for the Dec. 16 return of hit reality cooking competition â€œCulinary Class Warsâ€ with the release of its main trailer, as antic
body:
Netflix is gearing up for the Dec. 16 return of hit reality cooking competition â€œCulinary Class Warsâ€ with the release of its main trailer, as anticipation builds for the sophomore season of the unscripted series.

	The trailer launch comes as excitement mounts for the showâ€™s return. The format made history last year as the first Korean reality series to top Netflixâ€™s Global Top 10 (Non-English TV) list for three consecutive weeks. The show also earned recognition as â€œthe most beloved series among Korean viewersâ€ in Gallup Koreaâ€™s September 2024 survey.
	

	The first season was widely credited with revitalizing Seoulâ€™s dining scene, which saw increased restaurant bookings and renewed interest in the cityâ€™s culinary talent.


	Season 2 introduces new rules and heightened competition, including the return of two masked contestants seeking redemption. The format retains the signature blind tastings that became the showâ€™s calling card, with judges evaluating dishes purely on flavor to eliminate bias.

	The White Spoon lineup features two-Michelin-star chef Lee Jun and Son Jong-won, who holds one Michelin star each in Korean and Western cuisine. Venerable Sunjae brings expertise as Koreaâ€™s first master of Buddhist temple cuisine, while Hou Deok-juk contributes 57 years of Chinese cuisine experience and Park Hyo-nam offers 47 years in French cuisine. The roster also includes popular chefs Jung Ho-young, Sam Kim, Raymon Kim, MasterChef Korea Season 4 judge Song Hoon, and Hansik Battle Season 3 winner Im Seong-keun.

	The Black Spoons return with competitors bearing colorful monikers including â€œThree Star Killer,â€ â€œSeochon Prince,â€ â€œCulinary Monster,â€ and â€œBarbecue Lab Director.â€ Newcomers â€œCulinary Innovatorâ€ and â€œWok Riderâ€ promise to add fresh dynamics to the competition, with hints of unexpected alliances in store.
	

	The announcement comes as Korean drama â€œPhysical: Asiaâ€ continues to hold a spot in Netflixâ€™s Global Non-English Top 10 list for its third consecutive week.

	Watch the â€œCulinary Class Warsâ€ Season 2 trailer here:

schema.headline: â€˜Culinary Class Warsâ€™ Season 2 Trailer Drops on Netflix Ahead of December Return

title: â€˜Tehranâ€™ Breakout Star Niv Sultan Plays a Young Police Investigator in Keshetâ€™s New Crime Thriller â€˜Murder at the Dead Seaâ€™ From â€˜Red Skiesâ€™ Producer (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Niv Sultan, the breakout star of â€œTehran,â€ leads the cast of a new crime thriller, â€œMurder at the Dead Sea,â€ which is produced by Yoav Gross Product
body:
Niv Sultan, the breakout star of â€œTehran,â€ leads the cast of a new crime thriller, â€œMurder at the Dead Sea,â€ which is produced by Yoav Gross Productions, the banner behind â€œNutuk,â€ â€œRed Skiesâ€ and â€œManayek.â€ 

	Keshet International has boarded worldwide sales on the seven-part show and will introduce it to buyers at the London TV Screenings on Feb. 24. Currently in post-production and set to premiere on Keshet 12 on Dec. 22, â€œMurder at the Dead Seaâ€ is created by Raz Yuvan (â€œKfula,â€ â€œHezi and Sonsâ€), directed by Tomer Shani (â€œCarthargo,â€ â€œNehamaâ€). 
	

	Set against Israelâ€™s Dead Sea, â€œMurder at the Dead Seaâ€ opens with the mysterious death of Sarah Hacohen, a pop icon whose body plummets from the ninth floor of a quarantined hotel during the height of the pandemic. What begins as an apparent suicide quickly unravels into a dark web of deceit, betrayal, and murder. Trapped in isolation, young police investigator Revi Shem-Tov (Sultan) must uncover the truth among a group of quarantined strangersâ€”each hiding secrets more dangerous than the virus itself.


	â€œâ€˜Murder at the Dead Seaâ€™ is a high-end thriller that reinvents the locked-room mystery for todayâ€™s global audience,â€ said Kelly Wright, Keshet Internationalâ€™s managing director of distribution. â€œIt features a stunning and exotic location, twisty plot, and an outstanding performance from Niv Sultan.â€ 

	Karni Ziv, Keshet 12â€™s head of drama and comedy, adds: â€œWe think Keshet 12 viewers are going to love this contemporary reimagining of the classic Agatha Christie whodunnit set in a COVID hotel by the Dead Sea, because it combines the taut suspense of â€˜And Then There Were Noneâ€™ with the cinematic storytelling of â€˜The White Lotus.'â€
	

	Recent scripted commissions by Keshet 12 include the October 7 drama, â€œRed Alertâ€ which ranks as Israelâ€™s highest-rated drama of the last decade; â€œNutuk,â€ a gripping suspense drama where a boyâ€™s memories of another life lead two families into the heart of a buried murder mystery; and â€œSave the Date,â€ a romantic comedy starring Tomer Capone.

schema.headline: â€˜Tehranâ€™ Breakout Star Niv Sultan Plays a Young Police Investigator in Keshetâ€™s New Crime Thriller â€˜Murder at the Dead Seaâ€™ From â€˜Red Skiesâ€™ Producer (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Diddy Jurors Reveal Reasons Behind Mixed Verdict in Netflix Doc: Cassie â€˜Wanted to Be With Him,â€™ and Domestic Violence Wasnâ€™t One of the Charges
description:
SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning,â€ now streaming on Netflix.

	There are many voices in the new Netflix do
body:
SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning,â€ now streaming on Netflix.

	There are many voices in the new Netflix docuseries â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning,â€ but some of the most intriguing are two of the jurors which delivered Sean â€œDiddyâ€ Combs a split verdict in court this year.

	Jurors 160 and 75 both spoke as part of director Alexandria Stapletonâ€™s project, giving intriguing information on how they interpreted the accusations against Combs in court, and how they think his celebrity might have influenced their verdict.
	

	Combs was on trial on charges of sex trafficking by force, transportation for the purposes of prostitution and racketeering. His New York City trial began on May 5, 2025, and the jury delivered a verdict on July 2, after three days of deliberation. They ultimately found Combs guilty on the two counts of transportation for the purposes of prostitution, but acquitted him on the sex trafficking or racketeering charges. The mixed verdict landed Combs in prison for four years, including time served â€”Â a mild sentence, considering he faced life behind bars.


	Juror 160, a Millennial woman, identified herself as â€œof that generation who basically grew up listening to the music that he was involved in. From Biggie to 112 â€¦ I even like Day26. I wasnâ€™t a personal fan of his, but in general, the music.â€

	She said a critical part of the verdict was the actual charges brought forward. The music mogulâ€™s violence toward his longtime girlfriend Cassie Ventura â€”Â which Diddy showed plainly in an infamous video released by CNN â€”Â was not part of the discussion.
	

	â€œ[Itâ€™s] unforgivable, honestly. You canâ€™t beat that small girl like that the way he didâ€¦ [but] domestic violence wasnâ€™t one of the charges,â€ she said.

	Meanwhile, Juror 75, a middle-aged man who said that before the trial he had â€œzero knowledge aboutâ€ Combs, said he was confused about how guilty Combs could be when his Ventura had stayed in their on-and-off relationship for 11 years.

	â€œThat was a very, very interesting relationship versus two people in love,â€ he said. â€œThey are overly loved. They cannot explain. She wanted to be with him. He took her for granted. He never thought that she would leave and go. So just like both hands clapping together, you cannot clap with one hand, they both end like this. Then you get the noiseâ€

	â€œThe very next day, the following day [following domestic violence incidents], if you see how theyâ€™re getting back together and exchanging text messages and like nothing ever happened,â€ he said later in â€œThe Reckoning.â€ â€œSo now we are confused â€¦ whatâ€™s going on here? Heâ€™s beating her, and the next minute theyâ€™re going on dinners and trips. Itâ€™s like going back and forth, back and forth, back and forth. Thatâ€™s my answer. I mean, if you donâ€™t like something, you completely get out. You cannot have it both ways.â€

	Despite being confident about their verdict, Juror 160 knew it would be controversial.

	â€œWhen we were in the deliberation room, and weâ€™ve come to an agreement, and weâ€™re only saying that heâ€™s guilty for these two counts, my words exactly were, â€˜Oh S-H-I-T,'â€ she said.

	Combsâ€™ camp has been vocal about their disdain for â€œThe Reckoning,â€ releasing a statement on Dec. 1 saying, â€œNetflixâ€™s so-called â€˜documentaryâ€™ is a shameful hit piece. Todayâ€™s GMA teaser confirms that Netflix relied on stolen footage that was never authorized for release. As Netflix and CEO Ted Sarandos know, Mr. Combs has been amassing footage since he was 19 to tell his own story, in his own way. It is fundamentally unfair, and illegal, for Netflix to misappropriate that work.â€ Read the whole response here.

schema.headline: Diddy Jurors Reveal Reasons Behind Mixed Verdict in Netflix Doc: Cassie â€˜Wanted to Be With Him,â€™ and Domestic Violence Wasnâ€™t One of the Charges

title: Brazilâ€™s BrLab Adds Kids Lab, Green Push for 15th Edition Next April (EXCLUSIVE)
description: As SÃ£o Paulo-based development and training hub BrLab gears up for its 15th anniversary edition in 2026, one of Latin Americaâ€™s most influential pro
body:
As SÃ£o Paulo-based development and training hub BrLab gears up for its 15th anniversary edition in 2026, one of Latin Americaâ€™s most influential project labs has opened submissions and unveiled a raft of changes designed to expand its reach, deepen its support for emerging talent and push sustainability up the regional agenda.

	The 15th BrLab will run April 7-14, primarily in SÃ£o Paulo, with satellite activities in Brasilia and Recife. Producers, directors and writers from across Latin America, Spain and Portugal will convene for a week of labs, market encountersÂ and open-industry programming.
	

	Applications for its four 2026 workshops â€“ BrLab Features, BrLab Rough Cut, BrLab Audience Design and the new BrLab Kids â€“ are free and open from Nov. 12 to Dec. 12, 2025 via the labâ€™s website.


	â€œFor us, every edition is an opportunity to identify whatâ€™s being imagined across the region,â€ says BrLab founder, director and curator Rafael Sampaio. â€œThe industry trusts us with new ideas year after year.â€

	Founded in 2011 and organized by Klaxon Cultura Audiovisual, BrLab has grown from a small workshop for Latin American features into a compact but influential platform, more training hub than full-blown market, yet firmly embedded in the regional calendar for projects looking to sharpen their creative and financial strategies.

	Supported by institutions such as the Ibermedia program, Projeto Paradiso and Spcine â€“ and now Petrobras as a multi-year sponsor â€“ BrLab receives more than 400 submissions annually, curated by a professional selection committee.Â 
	

	As of 2025, 62 features that passed through its various sections have been produced and released, 17 more are in post-production and another 10 are financed for production through 2026. By next year the tally of completed films linked to the lab is expected to approach 90.

	Many have premiered at top-tier festivals, including Cannes, Venice, Berlin, San SebastiÃ¡n, Locarno, Sundance and Toronto. Recent standouts include â€œThe Mysterious Gaze of the Flamingo,â€ which won the top prize at Cannesâ€™ Un Certain Regard; â€œLevanteâ€ (Cannes Criticsâ€™ Week 2023); â€œLÃ©gua,â€ which screened at Cannesâ€™ Directorsâ€™ Fortnight; Sundance title â€œLos Tiburonesâ€; Berlinale competition multi-prize winner â€œLas Heiressesâ€; and San SebastiÃ¡n Golden Shell laureate â€œLos Reyes del Mundo.â€ â€œThe Wolf Behind the Door,â€ selected in BrLabâ€™s very first edition in 2011, later bowed at Toronto and San SebastiÃ¡n, announcing a new talent to track in Fernando Coimbra.

	AvoidingÂ the Crowded FallÂ Festival Corridor

	Starting with this 15th edition, BrLab has permanently shifted from its traditional October slot to early April. The move is designed to avoid the crowded fall festival corridor and give projects more time to polish scripts and cuts before premiering in the back half of the year.

	â€œThis change creates a more useful rhythm for project development,â€ Sampaio says. â€œWe want our selected teams to take full advantage of the international circuit, and April positions them well to do that â€“ especially for the Rough Cut Lab.â€

	In 2021,Â BrLabÂ launchedÂ BrLab CoPro, a curated boutique co-production forum aimed at galvanizing new partnerships with Brazil and other Latin American territories. The forum invites producers, funds, sales agents and broadcasters looking to structure cross-border packages at a time when co-production has become essential for financing and circulation.

	ThisÂ platform isÂ deepening BrLabâ€™s role as a connector not only of talent but of the institutional and industrial players that can actually get films made.

	Flagship Labs and Audience Design

	The programâ€™s backbone remains BrLab Features, focused on fiction features from Latin America plus Spain and Portugal. 12 projects will receive mentorship on script, direction, production and distribution from a roster of regional heavyweights. Longtime backer Programa Ibermedia, a partner since the first edition, will once again offer participation grants to selected teams.
	

	Running in parallel, BrLab Rough Cut caters to fiction and documentary features in the editing stage from across the Ibero-American world, pairing each project with an editing tutor and a small group of peers to help fine-tune the cut and position the film for festivals, sales and distribution.

	After an initial phase centered on Brazil, BrLabâ€™s Audience Design program returns with a broader remit, now open to the whole of Latin America and the Iberian Peninsula. Inspired by methodologies Sampaio first encountered at TorinoFilmLab, the workshop helps teams think strategically about audiences from development onwards, mapping core and secondary viewers and plotting release paths that can combine festivals, theaters, platforms and alternative circuits.

	â€œIn Brazil everyone talks about â€˜creating new audiences,â€™ but for years people have become disconnected from our own cinema â€” theyâ€™re simply not educated to see themselves on screen,â€ Sampaio explained. â€œThatâ€™s why we need spaces like BrLab, where Latin American narratives and histories can be developed and protected, even as we keep one eye on the market, because being represented on screen is a right.â€

	Kids Lab in Recife

	The biggest new innovation now announced for 2026 is BrLab Kids, a new workshop dedicated to film and series projects for children and young audiences, which will unspool in Recife. The initiative responds to what Sampaio sees as a chronic lack of specific public policy and institutional support for kids content in Brazil and much of Latin America.

	â€œIf children donâ€™t grow up watching Latin American stories, they wonâ€™t feel connected to our history and our cinema when they become adults,â€ he argued.

	Projects selected for BrLab Kids will receive tutorship from writers specialized in young audiences, including JanaÃ­na Tokitaka and Gabriella Mancini, alongside pedagogical consultants. Recife-based producer Nara AragÃ£o will oversee production mentoring.

	For Sampaio, the kids strand is closely linked to the audience-design push, offering a space to tackle the challenges of family titles competing with U.S. studio fare while trying to build a loyal local audience for regional stories.

	Green Initiative With Petrobras

	Backed for the first time by Petrobras as presenting partner and lead sponsor, BrLabâ€™s 15th edition will also launch a sustainability push. Curated by pioneering green-production specialist Ariane Ferreira, the lab has assembled Think Tank BrLab Petrobras, together with Cinema Verde Festival, an initiative to adapt emerging international eco-standards to Latin American realities and to encourage local institutions to integrate environmental criteria into film funding.
	

	Sampaio points to new European reports and incentive schemes around greener film and TV production as a reference, but stresses that Latin America is starting from a different baseline. The aim, he says, is to convene the industry around practical steps that can be progressively adopted in the region.

	â€œIn many cases, the only real green practices in our region are happening on big international streamer shows that arrive with their own protocols,â€ he says. â€œIf we can pilot ideas in the audiovisual sector, that can also inspire changes in other parts of society.â€

	Co-Production Hub in a Rebounding Brazil

	BrLabâ€™s 15th edition comes as Brazilian cinema experiences renewed momentum. After years of funding paralysis, minority co-production schemes have been revived and Brazil is once again fast consolidating as a sought-after partner on major Latin American projects, often in combination with European finance.

	â€œToday, foreign projects can come to BrLab to find Brazilian minority co-producers,â€ Sampaio notes. â€œWhen we launched, Ibermedia was practically the only co-production avenue. Now there are multiple funds, and the lab has become a natural meeting point.â€



	

					Audience design session at BrLab 2019
									Bella Tozini

schema.headline: Brazilâ€™s BrLab Adds Kids Lab, Green Push for 15th Edition Next April (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Aubrey Oâ€™Day Says She Was Fired From Danity Kane for â€˜Not Participating Sexuallyâ€™ With Diddy; Struggles to Recall Alleged Assault: â€˜I Donâ€™t Even Know if I Was Raped and I Donâ€™t Want to Knowâ€™
description:
SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning,â€ now streaming on Netflix.

	Aubrey Oâ€™Day, who was picked to be in Sean
body:
SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning,â€ now streaming on Netflix.

	Aubrey Oâ€™Day, who was picked to be in Sean â€œDiddyâ€ Combsâ€™ girl group Danity Kane during the third season of â€œMaking the Band,â€ has joined the voices speaking about the rap mogulâ€™s alleged pattern of abuse during his time in the music industry in the just-released Netflix docuseries â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning.â€


	Oâ€™Day began telling her story by saying how she was treated as a member of the Danity Kane. â€œDiddy made it clear that I was â€˜the looker,'â€ Oâ€™Day said. â€œI remember that phrase a lot. He was separating me and there was a different set of expectations from me, and I just naturally float into the grooming.â€
	

	When asked when she thought her collaboration with Combs â€œcrossed the line of becoming sexual,â€ Oâ€™Day said, â€œThere are emails with pictures of his penis.â€ She read one of his emails out loud, which included passages like, â€œâ€˜I donâ€™t wanna just fuck you. I wanna turn you out. I can see you being with some motherfucker that you tell what to do. I make my woman do what I tell her to do, and she loves it. I just want â€” and like â€” to do things different. Iâ€™mma finish watching this porn and finish masturbating. Iâ€™ll think of you, happy face. If you change your mind and get ready to do what I say, hit me. Happy face. God bless, Diddy. God is the greatest.â€™

	â€œThis is your boss at your work sending you that e-mail,â€ she continued. â€œWhat happens in real life to anyone else? Your boss gets fired. Six months later, I was fired. I absolutely felt that I was fired for not participating sexually, but I also found out later that [fellow Danity Kane member] Dawn [Richard] and Puff were recording a different project. I was the star of the show, and Puff needed to move that entire audience over to a new project.â€
	

	When asked about individual accusations in â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning,â€ Combsâ€™ legal counsel sent a statement to Variety, writing, â€œWeâ€™re not going to comment on individual claims being repeated in the documentary. Many of the people featured have longstanding personal grievances, financial motives, or credibility issues that have been documented for years. Several of these stories have already been addressed in court filings, and others were never raised in any legal forum because theyâ€™re simply not true. The project was built around a one-sided narrative led by a publicly admitted adversary, and it repeats allegations without context, evidence, or verification Sean Combs will continue to address legitimate matters through the legal process, not through a biased Netflix production.â€ When asked specifically about Oâ€™Dayâ€™s allegations in the docuseries, a representative for Combs did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Combsâ€™ team also released a longer statement about the project overall here.

	Later in the series, Oâ€™Day said she was informed of an affidavit that was received during the flood of civil lawsuits filed against Combs. In it, a woman alleges that she accidentally walked into a room where Oâ€™Day was â€œsprawled out on a leather couch, looking very inebriated. She was naked from the bottom half, and she had something over her top. Puff Daddy was penetrating in her vagina, and there was another stalky light-skinned man with his penis in her mouth.â€

	After reading the affidavit on camera, Oâ€™Day said she is conflicted because, â€œI didnâ€™t have a recollection of this.â€ She also stated that â€œI didnâ€™t drink like that at all â€”Â I donâ€™t drink at all, itâ€™s never been an issue with me.â€

	â€œDoes this mean I was raped?â€ Oâ€™Day asked. â€œIs that what this means? I donâ€™t even know if I was raped, and I donâ€™t want to know. I donâ€™t want to find out any more that that woman has to say. If she made it up, I would be compelled to take her the fuck down. You realize the burden that that puts on my soul for the past year, which is if I expose one victim whoâ€™s got a civil lawsuit, that gives Diddy and his legal team credit to take down everybody else as potential liars. Says Aubrey Oâ€™Day! It goes right back on my shoulders, just like that. The weight of that man and his bullshit â€¦ I will never get up from under it.â€

schema.headline: Aubrey Oâ€™Day Says She Was Fired From Danity Kane for â€˜Not Participating Sexuallyâ€™ With Diddy; Struggles to Recall Alleged Assault: â€˜I Donâ€™t Even Know if I Was Raped and I Donâ€™t Want to Knowâ€™

title: Comedian Naomi Watanabe Sets North American Tour â€˜From Tokyoâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
Naomi Watanabe is coming to America and Canada.

	The comedian has set dates for her â€œFrom Tokyoâ€ North American tour. This will mark her first full
body:
Naomi Watanabe is coming to America and Canada.

	The comedian has set dates for her â€œFrom Tokyoâ€ North American tour. This will mark her first fully English-language tour.

	â€œThe last few years have been full of big changes for both myself as a person and my comedy, and I canâ€™t wait to share what Iâ€™ve been up to with audiences all around North America,â€ Watanabe said in a statement Tuesday. â€œThis tour would not be possible without the love and support of my fans from the U.S., Canada, Japan and beyond. Thank you, and I canâ€™t wait to meet friends â€“ old and new â€“ on the road this spring.â€
	

	The tour begins April 17 in Los Angeles at The Wiltern followed by 17 dates before concluding on June 13 in Vancouver, British Columbia.


	Watanabe first garnered attention in Japan in 2007 for her sketch comedy and original characters. She eventually moved to New York City, launching her podcast â€œNaomi Takes Americaâ€ in 2023 and a companion seven-city live tour. She made her English-language stand up debut, â€œStand Up with Naomi Watanabe,â€ in 2024, selling out two shows at the Gramercy Theatre in New York City within an hour. She will also headline a solo sketch comedy show in Japan in 2026.

	Earlier this year, Watanabe voiced Ambassador Auva in the English and Japanese versions of the Disney-Pixar film â€œElio.â€

	â€œFrom Tokyoâ€ tickets will be available starting with a Citi presale beginning Dec. 3. Additional presales will run throughout the week ahead of the general on sale at naomiwatanabe.com beginning Dec. 5 at 10 a.m. ET/1 p.m. PT.
	

	See the complete list of tour dates and locations below.

schema.headline: Comedian Naomi Watanabe Sets North American Tour â€˜From Tokyoâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: A24 and Film4 Team for Sonoya Mizunoâ€™s Directorial Debut â€˜Stages,â€™ Alex Garland Producing
description: Sonoya Mizuno, best known as an actress and star of â€œEx Machina,â€ â€œDevs,â€ â€œHouse of the Dragonâ€ and â€œCrazy Rich Asians,â€ has set her directorial deb
body:
Sonoya Mizuno, best known as an actress and star of â€œEx Machina,â€ â€œDevs,â€ â€œHouse of the Dragonâ€ and â€œCrazy Rich Asians,â€ has set her directorial debut. 

	â€œStagesâ€ is being produced by both A24 and Film4, with Mizunoâ€™s regular collaborator Alex Garland set to produce alongside Peter Rice, Agile Filmsâ€™ Myles Payne and Sam Ritzenberg.

	Details of the project remain under wraps, but the film is said to be inspired by Mizunoâ€™s own dance background.Â Alongside her acting, Mizuno trained at the Royal Ballet School. She then danced in ballet companies including English National Ballet, Dresden Semper Oper Ballet and Scottish Ballet. â€œEx Machinaâ€ marked her on-screen acting debut, playing an android who performs a disco dance with Oscar Isaac. In â€œDevs,â€ also written and directed by Garland, she had the lead role as a software engineer at a quantum computer company who investigates the sudden apparent suicide of her boyfriend.
	

	Speaking to Variety at the time of â€œDevs,â€ Mizuno said while she wasnâ€™t particularly tech-savvy herself, the show confirmed and challenged her beliefs about the pervasiveness of big tech.


	â€œI remember reading the script, like, â€˜I want to talk about these tech leaders who are controlling the way our society is run because our governments donâ€™t have the structure to support how fast the industry is growing,â€™ and it felt like an amazing opportunity to do that,â€ she said.

	A24 and Film have previously collaborated on projects including last yearâ€™s Oscar winner â€œThe Zone of Interestâ€ and the drama â€œWe Live in Time.â€

schema.headline: A24 and Film4 Team for Sonoya Mizunoâ€™s Directorial Debut â€˜Stages,â€™ Alex Garland Producing

title: â€˜Looking for Michael,â€™ a Parkinsonâ€™s-Themed Comedy, Brought to Ventana Sur by Filmax (EXCLUSIVE)Â
description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina â€” Strengthening the comedy quotient of this yearâ€™s Ventana Sur, already on the rise in the marketâ€™s centrepiece industry sec
body:
BUENOS AIRES, Argentina â€” Strengthening the comedy quotient of this yearâ€™s Ventana Sur, already on the rise in the marketâ€™s centrepiece industry sections, Barcelona-based studio Filmax is bringing onto the market â€œLooking for Michael,â€ produced by Kiko Martinez, who backed Alex de la Iglesiaâ€™s â€œPerfect Strangers.â€

	International buyers will be able to see the first images of the film at the Ventana Sur market in Buenos Aires.Â 
	

	Filmax will be handling the international sales of â€œLooking For Michael.â€ It will introduce first images of the film at Buenos Airesâ€™ Ventana Sur, Latin Americaâ€™s biggest film-TV market.Â 


	The latest from Juana MacÃ­as, whose acerbic screwball family comedy â€œJust One Small Favorâ€ was also picked up by Filmax, â€œLooking for Michaelâ€ sums up several market trends: Itâ€™s an uplifting take on a serious subject, and a eye-opening comedy of substance Â  Â  Â 

	Penned by Marta Libertad, a writer on Rafael Azcona adaptation â€œThe Europeans,â€ â€œLooking for Michaelâ€ turns on Â 

	Sonia, a young woman whoâ€™s been diagnosed with Parkinsonâ€™s. Determining to face her disease with energy and hope, rather than resignation, along with her music therapy group â€“ whose members live with OCD, paraplegia, Parkinsonâ€™s, and autism â€“ she embarks to find Michael J. Fox, a global icon in the fight against Parkinsonâ€™s.Â 

	â€œLooking for Michaelâ€ stars Nuria Herrero, Vito Sanz (â€œThe Other Way Aroundâ€), Paco Tous (â€œMoney Heistâ€) Lorena LÃ³pez, Sara Robisco and Michel Noher (â€œLa Unidadâ€).
	

	The comedy, which also has a profoundly emotional side to it , is inspired by real events, Filmax notes. The film uses music as a vehicle of expression, autonomy and connection, exploring how art can transform lives and unite people, it added.

	The comedy â€œtackles a serious subject (disability and Parkinsonâ€™s) from a wonderfully positive place and without being overly sentimental,â€ said Head of International IvÃ¡n DÃ­az. â€œThe music, sense of humour and authenticity of its characters make this a universal story, one which is able to connect with audiences of all cultures.â€Â 



	

					â€˜Looking for Michael,â€™ courtesy of Filmax

title: Waymo Drives Through Middle of Police Standoff
description:
Waymo
                          Drives Thru Middle of Police Standoff in L.A.
body:
Waymo
                          Drives Thru Middle of Police Standoff in L.A.
                      
                  
                        Published December 1, 2025 4:39 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          If driverless cars are the future, we might see way more of this ... a Waymo took a left turn smack dab into the middle of a police standoff ... and it's all on video.
      
    
          Viral video spreading on social media shows one of the driverless ride service vehicles taking a left turn in downtown Los Angeles ... cruising right into the middle of some crossfire.
      
    
      
      Waymo with passengers just drove into a middle of standoffIt doesnâ€™t have a crossfire in its program â€” it guessed the best option is to go under the fireThe RoboCop we deserve pic.twitter.com/X4KykjG7siâ€” RT (@RT_com) December 1, 2025
              @RT_com
          
  
    
          Problem is ... the Waymo goes right past a man who is on the ground face down next to a truck ... as LAPD cars and officers line up behind him and shout commands.
      

          Adding dramatic effect ... a LAPD helicopter is heard circling overhead ... and folks taking the video chuckle at the bumbling Waymo driving into the eye of the storm.
      
    
          A rep for Waymo tells TMZ ... the vehicle cleared the scene in a matter of seconds -- and the passengers inside made it safely to their destination.
      
    
          Waymo's rollout in Los Angeles hasn't been without some speed bumps ... a car got pulled over in Beverly Hills for an illegal turn and Waymo suspended service this summer when cars were torched amid protests over immigration raids.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Plus, we've seen Waymos get stuck in fast food drive thrus and take riders around in circles instead of getting them to the airport.
      
    
          Horse and buggy, anyone?!?
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Fairly Legal
              
                          
                News
              
                          
                Police

schema.headline: Waymo Drives Through Middle of Police Standoff

title: Channing Tatum, Jenna Dewan Get Cut of Exes' Retirement Benefits In Divorce
description:
Channing Tatum, Jenna Dewan
                          I'll Take Half Your Pension!!!
body:
Channing Tatum, Jenna Dewan
                          I'll Take Half Your Pension!!!
                      
                  
                        Published December 1, 2025 5:10 PM PST
                                                                      |
                Updated December 1, 2025 6:08 PM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Channing Tatum and Jenna Dewan's divorce settlement wasn't public, but now we've got a financial nugget from how it all played out ... they're getting a chunk of the other's retirement plans.
      
    
          According to new legal docs, obtained by TMZ, Channing and Jenna signed off on a 50 percent split of the other's retirement benefits from the Screen Actors Guild-Producers Pension Plan.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          It's unclear how much that slice of the pie is actually worth ... but the docs say the retirement benefits are calculated by dividing pension credit earned during their 2009 to 2018 marriage by total pension credit earned.
      

          As we reported ... Channing and Jenna finalized their divorce in September 2024, some six long years after the actress first filed to end their marriage.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Channing and Jenna previously decided who gets what of their assets, and even settled on a child support arrangement ... and now we get a peek into one part of how it all played out.
      
    
          It took a while to get there, but Channing says he and Jenna are back on good terms finally.
      
    
          US Weekly was first to report the docs.
